column4: Hi! I installed an external eth0 driver, how can I get eth0 to be 'ifupped' automatically?
I have 1024mb RAM but system monitor only shows 885?
install a -686 kernel
e.g., install the linux-686 package
allright, thanks :)
why are you trying to compile your own kernel?
because I need something that 2.6.13 has and 2.6.12 doesnt :)
which is?
I'm quite serious about asking which things are missing, since if 2.6.12 is missing support for your hardware, that should be added to buntu's kernel
well my NIC needs the sk98lin driver, "Marvell Yukon Chipset / SysKonnect SK-98xx Support" In kernel config. It's a 1000mb eth card, integrated with my ASUS a8v-e Deluxe m/b.
2.6.12 has no driver for that at all?
have you filed a bug?
not yet
you already have it installed
do you mean "GTK header files"?
well something I need in order to be able to ./configure an application.. it tells me 'checking for GLIB - version >= 2.4.0... no
that would have been a better first question for you to ask; install libgtk2.0-dev
tho you probably will end needing gnome-devel; what are you compiling?
#ubuntu-motu
no
is there another way of doing this
not unless it can use the uid module
what are you trying to achieve?
no, what program, and why?
